page.title: 08Ordley,Old and New.
page.content: The village of{Ordley}stood on a promontory above Devils Water. In {1663}it was described as a 'large towne'of 400 people,on the old pack horse route from Allendale to Hexham.However,{population dwindled, buildings fell into disrepair,and with the closure of the school in 1953,the {village virtually died.}However, a far-seeing property developer realised the opportunities for{re-development, and Ordley Village is about to be reborn.{4}of the existing derelict buildings,the Farmhouse, School Cottage,and 2 barns,are being{restored and converted, and there are plans for {6 new houses}to be constructed. In a year or two's time,there should be a new Ordley village, standing on the site of the old.
